books.description: The essential rulebook for every D&D player! Contains character creation (races, classes, backgrounds), spells, equipment, and the fundamental rules of how to play the game. If you're a player, START HERE! (This is a Black & White, smaller file size version).
books.title: Player's Handbook (OCR Black&White) Small Size

books.description: The essential rulebook for every D&D player! Contains character creation (races, classes, backgrounds), spells, equipment, and the fundamental rules of how to play the game. If you're a player, START HERE! (This is the full-color version).
books.title: Player's Handbook (Color)

books.description: For Dungeon Masters: A huge collection of monsters, creatures, and potential adversaries to challenge your players. Includes statistics, lore, pictures, and tips for using monsters in your game. Essential for running most adventures.
books.title: Monster Manual

books.description: For Dungeon Masters: Your guide to running the game! Covers creating adventures, magic items, optional rules, world-building advice, and tips for managing the game session. A must-have if you plan to be the DM!
books.title: Dungeon Master's Guide

books.description: Adds high-level monsters, lore about cosmic conflicts, and several new playable race options. Primarily useful for DMs looking for powerful foes and world lore. Note: Many races/monsters updated in 'Monsters of the Multiverse'.
books.title: Mordenkaine's Tome Of Foes

books.description: Features detailed lore and stats for various monstrous races (some playable), adding depth to classic D&D creatures. Great for DMs wanting more monster variety and background. Note: Many races/monsters updated in 'Monsters of the Multiverse'.
books.title: Volo’s Guide to Monsters

books.description: A fantastic expansion primarily for players! Adds dozens of new subclasses for every class, many new spells, optional feats, and useful background tools. Highly recommended after the Player's Handbook.
books.title: Xanathar's Guide To Everything

books.description: Packed with player options! Includes more subclasses, the Artificer class reprinted, new spells, feats, magic items, optional class features to customize your character, and rules for sidekicks. Another great book after the Player's Handbook.
books.title: Tasha's Cauldron Of Everything

books.description: Explore the Sword Coast region of the Forgotten Realms (the most common D&D setting). Includes character options like subclasses (e.g., Swashbuckler Rogue, Bladesinger Wizard) and backgrounds specific to this famous area.
books.title: Sword Coast Adventure Guide

books.description: Play D&D in the Magic: The Gathering world of Ravnica! Features new races (like Loxodon and Vedalken), subclasses tied to city guilds, backgrounds, monsters, and items unique to this massive city setting.
books.title: Guildmasters’ Guide to Ravnica

books.description: A slightly humorous take on D&D, focusing on running your own adventuring franchise. Includes new player options (like the Gambler background), items, and roles within the company. Set in the Forgotten Realms.
books.title: Acquisition Incorporated

books.description: Dive into the unique 'magitech' world of Eberron. Introduces the Artificer class, new races (like Warforged and Shifters), Dragonmarks, and rich setting-specific lore.
books.title: Eberron Rising From The Last War

books.description: Based on the world featured in 'Critical Role'. Offers new subclasses (like Echo Knight), spells, magic items, monsters, and detailed information on the continent of Wildemount.
books.title: Explorer's Guide To Wildemount

books.description: Adventure in a world inspired by Greek mythology! Introduces new races (like Leonin and Satyrs), subclasses (e.g., Oath of Glory Paladin), the Piety system, mythic monsters, and powerful artifacts.
books.title: Mythic Odysseys of Theros

books.description: Explore the Domains of Dread. Provides tools for running horror adventures, new character options (Dhampir, Hexblood, Reborn races; Undead Warlock, College of Spirits Bard subclasses), monsters, and details on Ravenloft's gothic horror realms.
books.title: Van Richten's Guide To Ravenloft

books.description: A free official PDF supplement released alongside 'Princes of the Apocalypse'. Adds several element-themed races (like Aarakocra and Genasi) and spells. Good free content!
books.title: Elemental Evil Player's Companion

books.description: An official Unearthed Arcana (UA) playtest version of the Ranger class from 2016. UA content is experimental and not officially balanced. Always check with your DM before using UA material.
books.title: Revised Ranger (Unearthed Arcana)

books.description: A highly recommended starting adventure for new players and Dungeon Masters (Levels 1-5). A great introduction to D&D, set near the town of Phandalin.
books.title: Lost Mine Of Phandelver

books.description: Part one of the Tyranny of Dragons campaign (Levels 1-7). Players must stop the Cult of the Dragon from bringing the evil dragon goddess Tiamat into the world.
books.title: Hoard of the Dragon Queen

books.description: A large campaign focused on investigating and stopping four dangerous elemental cults (Levels 1-15). Can be used with the free 'Elemental Evil Player's Companion'.
books.title: Princes of The Apocalypse

books.description: Part two of the Tyranny of Dragons campaign (Levels 8-15). The epic conclusion where players face the Cult of the Dragon and potentially Tiamat herself.
books.title: The Rise Of Tiamat

books.description: A challenging adventure set in the dangerous, subterranean Underdark (Levels 1-15). Features themes of survival, madness, and escaping demonic lords.
books.title: Out Of The Abyss

books.description: A very popular gothic horror campaign set in the cursed land of Barovia (Levels 1-10). Players must survive the mists and confront the iconic vampire lord Strahd von Zarovich.
books.title: Curse Of Strahd

books.description: A sweeping adventure across the North of the Forgotten Realms involving giants causing chaos (Levels 1-11+). Features multiple possible starting points and paths.
books.title: Storm King's Thunder

books.description: A collection of seven updated classic D&D dungeons for various levels (1-11+). Good for shorter adventures or dropping iconic locations into your campaign.
books.title: Tales From The Yawning Portal

books.description: A deadly jungle exploration and dungeon crawl adventure set on the mysterious island of Chult (Levels 1-11). Features dinosaurs, traps, a death curse, and a challenging final dungeon.
books.title: Tomb of Annihilation

books.description: An urban intrigue and treasure hunt adventure set in the famous city of Waterdeep (Levels 1-5). Features multiple possible villains and paths.
books.title: Waterdeep Dragon Heist

books.description: A massive dungeon crawl through the legendary Undermountain beneath Waterdeep (Levels 5-20). Can follow up Waterdeep: Dragon Heist or stand alone.
books.title: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

books.description: A collection of seven updated classic nautical-themed adventures (Levels 1-12). Set around the coastal town of Saltmarsh, it includes rules for ships and sea travel.
books.title: Ghosts of Saltmarsh

books.description: A dark, epic adventure taking characters from Baldur's Gate into Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells (Levels 1-13). Features infernal war machines.
books.title: Baldur’s Gate: Descent into Avernus

books.description: A horror-themed adventure set in the frozen region of Icewind Dale (Levels 1-12). Features themes of survival, paranoia, and ancient secrets.
books.title: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

books.description: A collection of seventeen short, mystery-themed one-shot adventures connected to books found in Candlekeep (Levels 1-16). Great for single sessions.
books.title: Candlekeep Mysteries

books.description: Introduces the Grung, a playable race of poisonous frog-people. Originally extra content for charity, check with your DM if they allow this race. GRUNG CUTE!
books.title: One Grung Above

books.description: Introduces the Tortle, a playable race of anthropomorphic turtles. Originally extra content for charity, check with your DM if they allow this race.
books.title: The Tortle Package

books.description: Popular unofficial 'homebrew' content focusing on dark themes. This is NOT official D&D content; definitely check with your DM before using.
books.title: Dark Arts Player's Companion (Homebrew)

books.description: Not a rulebook! This is an official Dungeons & Dragons cookbook filled with recipes inspired by the game's fantasy worlds. Cook like a hero!
books.title: Heroes' Feast The Official D&D Cookbook

books.description: Everything about DRAGONS! Adds dragon-themed subclasses, new dragon races (Gem Dragons!), spells, magic items, tons of new dragon types, and deep dragon lore for DMs.
books.title: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons

books.description: A huge compilation updating over 250 monsters and over 30 playable races from previous books. Presents the most current versions of these options. Very useful for both players and DMs.
books.title: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

books.description: A third-party supplement for running modern, tech-heavy, or sci-fi campaigns using the D&D 5e rules framework. This is NOT official D&D content.
books.title: Ultramodern 5 (Third Party)

books.description: A third-party sci-fi setting and rules expansion designed to be compatible with the D&D 5e system. Explore space opera themes. This is NOT official D&D content.
books.title: Esper Genesis 5e (Third Party)

books.description: This appears to be for the Shadowrun system (likely 5th Edition), which is a completely DIFFERENT tabletop RPG blending cyberpunk and fantasy. It is NOT compatible with D&D 5e rules.
books.title: Shadowrun 5e (Different RPG System)

books.description: A third-party sci-fi rules conversion designed for use with D&D 5e. This is NOT official D&D content.
books.title: Fifth Age (Third Party)

books.description: A whimsical adventure into the magical Feywild plane (Levels 1-8). Offers options for resolving encounters without combat and introduces new fey creatures and races (Fairy, Harengon).
books.title: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

books.description: A collection of thirteen standalone adventures written by diverse authors, each set in a new location connected by the Radiant Citadel (Levels 1-14). Offers fresh perspectives and settings.
books.title: D&D's Journeys Through The Radiant Citadel

books.description: Set in the Magic: The Gathering world's magical university. Includes new player options (backgrounds, feats, spells), monsters, rules for student activities, plus four short adventures (Levels 1-10).
books.title: Strixhaven A Curriculum of Chaos

books.description: A campaign book inspired by 'Critical Role' set in the world of Exandria (Levels 3-12). Features underwater exploration, rival adventurers, and ties into the lore of the web series.
books.title: Critical Role - Call of the Netherdeep

books.description: A 192-page sourcebook exploring the lore and uses of the legendary Deck of Many Things. Includes new character options (feat, backgrounds, spells), magic items, monsters, NPCs, adventure locations, and advice for DMs on incorporating the Deck into campaigns.
books.title: The Book of Many Things: Book

books.description: A physical deck containing 66 illustrated cards representing an expanded version of the Deck of Many Things magic item. Includes the original 22 cards plus 44 new ones for customizable decks.
books.title: The Book of Many Things: Cards

books.description: An 80-page hardcover guidebook showcasing each card in the expanded 66-card Deck of Many Things, explaining their effects and offering guidance on using the deck.
books.title: The Book of Many Things: Card Reference

books.description: The revised Dungeon Master's Guide for the 2024 D&D rules update. Contains guidance for running the game, world-building tools, magic items, optional rules, and advice for Dungeon Masters. Designed to be compatible with previous 5th Edition materials.
books.title: Dungeon Master 2024

books.description: A short adventure module inspired by the Netflix series Stranger Things, featuring the Thessalhydra monster. Designed as an introductory adventure, likely for levels 1-4, based on Mike Wheeler's D&D campaign from the show.
books.title: Stranger Things Thessalyhydra

books.description: The revised Player's Handbook for the 2024 D&D rules update. Contains updated rules for character creation (races, classes, backgrounds), spells, equipment, feats, and how to play. Designed to be compatible with previous 5th Edition materials.
books.title: Players Handbook 2024

books.description: A supplement focusing on giants, narrated by Bigby. Includes giant lore, history, society, and religion. Adds player options: 1 Barbarian subclass (Path of the Giant), 2 backgrounds (Giant Foundling, Rune Carver), 8 feats (rune magic/giant power themed). Contains DM tools: 30+ magic items (including artifacts), 70+ new monsters/giant variants, lair maps, adventure hooks, encounter tables, and roleplaying advice.
books.title: Bigby Presents: Glory of Giants

books.description: An adventure module set in the Dragonlance world of Krynn during the War of the Lance (Levels 1-11). Introduces the setting, the Kender race, Knight of Solamnia/Mage of High Sorcery backgrounds, feats, a Lunar Sorcery subclass, new equipment, and monsters (including Lord Soth and draconians). Features optional mass battle integration with the 'Warriors of Krynn' board game. Includes a poster map.
books.title: Dragonlance Shadow of The Dragon Queen

books.description: An anthology of thirteen standalone, heist-themed adventures for various levels (1-11). Each adventure is designed as a short mission involving infiltration, theft, and extraction, often tied to a mysterious organization.
books.title: Keys from the Golden Vault

books.description: A campaign expanding on the classic 'Lost Mine of Phandelver' adventure (Levels 1-12). Starts with the original quests in Phandalin, then delves into a new storyline involving a malevolent cult, psionic corruption, mind flayers, and a journey into the Underdark and Far Realm to stop a threat related to a shattered obelisk.
books.title: Phandalver and Below: The Shattered Obelisk

books.description: A boxed set introducing the Spelljammer setting for 5e. Contains three 64-page books: 'Astral Adventurer's Guide' (setting info, 6 races like Giff/Plasmoid, backgrounds, spells, items, ship rules), 'Boo's Astral Menagerie' (60+ space creatures), and 'Light of Xaryxis' (adventure module for levels 5-8). Also includes a DM screen and poster map of the Rock of Bral.
books.title: Spelljammer Adventures in Space

books.description: A starter box set blending Dungeons & Dragons with the humor of Rick and Morty. Includes a streamlined rulebook with Rick's commentary, a dungeon-crawl adventure 'The Lost Dungeon Of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy' (Levels 1-3), 5 pre-generated character sheets based on the show's characters, a DM screen, and dice. Co-written by Jim Zub.
books.title: Dungeons & Dragons VS Rick & Morty
